Place of disembarkation: Fort de France (ou Fort Royal) Martinique
Various remarks: This is the account given by the captain to a sub-investor. The ship first went to Africa, was captured by the British and sent to Plymouth. It was then freed and went back to Africa, then Martinique and Nantes. Quickly after, he departed again in a direct voyage to get more sugar and arrived back to Nantes in 1817
